Title: data scientist sr- People Analytics (Remote)
JD:
About the job
    


Job Summary And Mission

Now Brewing – Senior Data Scientist, People Analytics #tobeapartner

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others.

As a Senior data scientist, you will support our people analytics efforts at Starbucks, focused on strengthening the Starbucks partner experience. As a member of our team, you will collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, data scientists, business experts, and external vendors to help Starbucks make better decisions by using data and analytics skills. In this role, you will lead strategic initiatives aimed at optimizing Starbucks retail store operations using data science and simulation, and building Starbucks' next generation labor model system to forecast the number of store partners required to meet customer demands. In this position, you will investigate business problems related to store operations, build data solutions, uncover insights, and explain them to drive better business decisions. You will be confident in communicating with all levels of business partners.

As a senior data scientist, you will… 
Lead the design and development of scalable data science solutions from the start to the finish by utilizing time series modeling, machine learning, and statistical analysis. Build scalable processes for cleaning, aggregating, and loading data.Understanding business initiatives, challenges, questions, concerns, or ideas, transforming them into successful data science solutions, and monitor data science metrics and KPIs Mentor data analysts & data scientists on best practices, processes, frameworks, and KPIsContribute to project planning, and assist the team with estimations, timelines, and prioritization. Assists in developing the analytical roadmap, data, and technology strategy. 
We’d Love To Hear From People With
Education: BS+ with a concentration in a quantitative discipline - Stats, Math, Comp Sci, Engineering, Econ, Quantitative Social Science or similar discipline. Masters preferredMinimum of 5+ years of industry experience in data and analytics workStrong problem-solving skills with the ability to influence leadership teams at different levelsSignificant experience working with predictive and statistical modeling, machine learning, and strong expertise in all phases of the modeling pipelineBusiness experience with data visualization tools and storytellingExperience in experimental design and common statistical analysis techniquesStrong SQL, databases, and ETL / ELT skills required including cleaning and managing data.Advanced competency and expertise in Python, R, or some combinationExperience with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, and GCPExperience working with distributed data processing frameworks such as Spark and Data bricks, and languages such as Java, PySpark, or ScalaExperience working with Dev Ops and/or ML Ops, preferred.Retail and eCommerce experience, preferred 
">

Title: undergraduate intern, data analyst, Starbucks Data, Analytics, Insights & Business Operations – Summer 2023 – Seattle, WA 2023 Starbucks Summer Internship Program
JD:
About the job
    


          Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

During The Starbucks Summer Internship Program, You Will

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection.
Influence business performance: make an impact through meaningful project work. Develop professionally: enhance your skills at workshops and business overviews. Foster connection: grow your network as you meet and learn from senior Starbucks leaders.  
About The Starbucks Summer Internship Program

Starbucks internships are paid, 11-week assignments (June – August 2023 at the Starbucks Support Center in Seattle - our corporate headquarters. Internships at Starbucks include great Intern perks: Starbucks Rewards Gold Status, Spotify Premium, 30% discount in company-owned Starbucks stores, Headspace Plus Membership

Note: Each student that successfully completes this internship may be considered for full-time career openings upon completion of a Bachelor’s degree program.

About Starbucks Analytics & Insights

Data, Analytics, Insights & Business Operations (DAIBO) helps Starbucks partners make decisions better with data, analytics, and insights. Our analyses and data products provide a view across Starbucks customers, stores, partners, supply chain, marketing, and more. Our analytics cloud ecosystem allows DAIBO partners to explore new data sources and create insights that reach across our business. You’ll influence our work on key projects that range from statistical analyses, to data visualization, to machine learning, to driving adoption of our tools and products. You will work closely with data analysists, decision scientists, and data scientists to answer enterprise business questions.

Data analyst intern in Data Democratization: Decisions made better through enterprise decision making tools & data visualization.  Where art meets science. We build 360 data front ends (e.g., Org 360) and decision-making tools with quantifiable business value (e.g., Impact Analysis Tool).  We also work on dashboard rationalization & consolidation and explore web applications & Tableau extensions.

Data analyst intern in Marketing/Product/Digital Data Science: Our team focuses on creating data-driven insights that inform business decisions in the marketing, product, and digital organizations. Our work ranges from descriptive analyses and ad-hoc deep dives, to predictive models and advanced data products. Our work is impactful, because we place a large emphasis on developing business acumen and stakeholder relationships.

We’d Love To Hear From Students With
Experience with data preparation: knowledge of cloud-based tools to summarize data, build data pipelines, automate data preparation processes. Skill with coding: experience working with SQL and R/Python For the Data Visualization intern: A project demonstrating data visualization skill (not a requirement for Data Science intern): hands-on experience and/or relevant coursework designing and building visualizations with Tableau, PowerBI, or D3 For the Data Science intern: Experience building statistical or machine learning models: hands-on experience and/or relevant coursework on statistical techniques (e.g., regression, t-tests, forecasting, etc.) or machine learning (e.g., random forests, clustering, etc.) 
Preferred Experience
Familiar with SQL, R, or Python Strong interpersonal skills including excellent communication and the ability to collaborate and work well with others Strong analytical and problem-solving habits. 
Internship Program Qualifications
Active enrollment in an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree Targeted graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024 Preference for: majors with quantitative disciple such as, but not limited to, Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Quantitative Social Science or similar discipline Recommended (but not required) minimum cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 Ability to work full time from June-August 2023 Eligibility to work in the United States  
Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com

Title: undergraduate intern, data analyst – Starbucks Technology Summer 2023
JD:
About the job
    


          Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

During The Starbucks Summer Internship Program, You Will

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection.
Influence business performance: make an impact through meaningful project work. Develop professionally: enhance your skills at workshops and business overviews. Foster connection: grow your network as you meet and learn from senior Starbucks leaders. 
About The Starbucks Summer Internship Program

The Starbucks Technology Internship Program is paid, full time, 13-week program (June – August 2023), designed to provide students with an opportunity to gain meaningful work experience in a field of interest and expertise within the Starbucks Technology Enterprise. This is a pipeline for full-time talent; each student selected for a Starbucks internship may be considered for full-time career openings upon successful completion of their internship and as opportunities become available within the organization. Roles may be based out of the Seattle Support Center or the Starbucks Technology Center in Scottsdale, Arizona.

Internships at Starbucks include great Intern perks: Starbucks Rewards Gold Status, Spotify Premium, 30% discount in company-owned Starbucks stores, Headspace Plus Membership

Note: Each student that successfully completes this internship may be considered for full-time career openings upon completion of a bachelor’s degree program.

Not only will you obtain hands-on industry experience, but you will:
Participate in round tables with Starbucks leaders across the organization Attend professional skill development workshops Take part-in social events, peer networking, and work closely with a mentor throughout your internship Explore Seattle or Phoenix! 
We’d Love To Hear From Students With
Experience with SQL, Python, and data analysis/modeling Proficient in data synthesis and data visualization Ability to work independently and as part of a team Strong interpersonal skills including effective written and verbal communication, and ability to collaborate in a highly cross-functional team Willingness to learn and adapt 
Internship Program Qualifications

   
Active enrollment in an accredited college or university pursuing a bachelor’s degree Targeted graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024 Recommended (but not required) minimum cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 Ability to work full time from June - August 2023 Eligibility to work in the United States                 
Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com
